pageContext.claim: “50 percent of the country is short-term testing.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump appears to have made up this number from thin air. In fact, "most existing methods for Covid-19 testing ... require a large amount of laboratory space, complex equipment, regulatory approvals for the laboratory operations, and skilled laboratory leadership and technicians. Results generally take time to become available, with windows ranging from hours to days, and the need for transport of specimens to a central laboratory leads to further delays," according to a study published in September by the New England Journal of Medicine.
